column1: We are scheduled to go to Provo at the beginning of April for one week. Does anyone else have concerns about the impact of the corona virus on travel to TCI? We are flying out of JFK. Obviously anything can happen in a month. Any thoughts?

My thought you have a bigger chance of bringing it with you, same chance as flu, and other ailments. Wash your hands, bring wipes for everything, will minimize your chances (The things CDC has been saying). So far code zero, you have a bigger chance of getting it in New York, yet chances are still slim)Good luck!Edited: 4:40 pm, March 09, 2020
Thanks, Blamona. It's that darn JFK Airport that has me more concerned than anything. I appreciate your response.
On the thought of "bringing it with you ". Is that fair to the local community. I'm struggling with the same thing. Don't know if I'm being selfish or doing the right thing by traveling at this time.

<< "Is that fair to the local community." >>If you've not been in close contact with someone who has coronavirus your chances of "bringing it with you" are negligible. Caution is one thing. But is it possible that over-reacting -- and not going -- is potentially just as unfair to the local community?
I don't think it is selfish at all. If I am healthy and able to travel from my area, why wouldn't I go! I handled the situation that would have caused me stress worrying about it.
We just came back Saturday and flew to and from JFK. Wash your hands and sanitize your tray, seat belt and all on plane.

That's all great but how would you know if you had been in contact with a positive person. Some carry the disease with no symptoms but are infectious. I personally have concerns about bringing this disease to a zero infection community. So some of you feel differently and that's fine . Or want to paint this as a foolish concern. While I consider that not giving that some thought to be selfish .

<< "I personally have concerns about bringing this disease to a zero infection community." >>So, obviously you're not leaving your house until the coronavirus is no more. Right?Or are you only concerned about bringing coronavirus to T&C?
Why does this bother you. What I feel. You do you and I'll do me. OK with you?
<< "Why does this bother you. What I feel. You do you and I'll do me. OK with you?" >>Pretty sure one of us doesn't understand the way a discussion forum works.:-)

I remember when some posters were being very flippant and joking about Zika on this forum when it first started.Edited: 9:29 pm, March 09, 2020

I think this whole thing is complicated. You want to live your life as if nothing is wrong. And, certainly, no one would travel nonchalantly if they were sick with the virus. We also rented an expensive villa this time, and I'm worried about losing the money. Anyone know about cancellations for reasons like this?

Did you get insurance (cancel for any reason) or does your credit card you use offer insurance?The way the island is treating it is holding to their cancelation policy. Currently at zero with no one Ill, planes are flying as always (and full). No one returns money based on a fear. (I fear flying! But don’t see getting money back for that)

nepatriot, my thoughts on this are that it would more likely come from a cruise ship visiting GT and then going over to Provo. I live in NY but not NYC. I am on the other side of the state and not flying into JFK. I am in the health care field but I work from home. I am being kept very informed by them. I am not travelling until May so a lot can change. I am relying on my airline and my own health to determine if I travel.

Here's an interesting stat... "In the United States, about 3 million cases of pneumonia are reported each year and about 60,000 people die as a result of the condition."...and yes "bacterial" pneumonia is catchy...There are approximately 800 cases of Corona Virus in the US currently....Dan

What is concerning about the coronavirus is that it spreads "0 to 90" practically overnight. Provo looks safe...but a valid point: GT is a cruise ship destination and it appears that cruise ships have helped coronavirus to travel."Mr. allfins" is scheduled for surgery tomorrow. We won't be joining this "dance" in the immediate, immediate future. ~~~allfins ><>Edited: 10:18 am, March 10, 2020

We have just been for one week on Grand Turk. Cruise ship passengers live in their world (visiting the beach within the cruise center, little organised tours, staying together). Our stay on Grand Turk was like a luxury quarantine.We are now for a week on Grace Bay Provo. Everything looks fine, so far no case.My opinion: If you do not have symptoms, no contacts to corona known it is a good time to visit Turks and Caicos Islands

We fly out of JFK on Friday for Provo and I'm not worried at all about the corona virus. I'm more worried about the flu and the Norovirus but I'm not really worried about them either. There's the difference between possibility and probability to be aware of. Where it is possible that I will contract the corona virus, the probability is very very low.See you Friday Grace Bay!

Kimberly, I actually am not worried even if I did get it because I am not in a high risk category for it and neither is my husband. I was more worried about the hysteria surrounding it and how that could affect my air travel.

This may have already been shared. If not here it is. The USA currently has a level 1 for risk of the corona virus. It is probably the best source of information rather than on a forum. https:/…index.html

I follow the Turks and Caicos Tourism facebook page and they posted that they are not allowing flights from countries with outbreaks. At this time I don't think the US is considered as having the outbreak but I would imagine in the near future that could happen. Following for my trip coming up the first week of May.

The US state department has issued a Global Level 3 Health Advisory – Reconsider Travel. https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/t…We are supposed to leave for our trip to Provo two weeks from today. Things are changing overnight and in a matter of days T&C may not let flights in and/or the US (and other countries) may ban flights out so we should pay close attention.
Following as well. Our trip is for mid April. A lot can change between now and then. Trying to stay updated and informed.

Thank you Kerry45 for your info which directs you to the Smart Traveler site where you can create an account and enter your travel times and destinations. At this point the only advisory for TCI is from Feb. regarding crime so I hope we will have no problems for our departure this Sunday!

We have decided to cancel our trip from April 4-11. I am heartbroken, but we are not spring chickens and also the travel restrictions just seem to be increasing.TCVillas has been wonderful and helpful without cancellation. We will be back for 3 weeks during Christmas.Of course, this is just our personal decision, and we wish everyone a wonderful trip.Edited: 1:44 pm, March 12, 2020
I meant to say the have been wonderful with our cancellation.

Tropicalbird, Were you able to just switch dates? We rented through TC Villas and are going to try and go later in the year with the hopes things have calmed down. We purchased insurance but since we aren't cancelling wasn't sure what route to go. Thanks for any advice!Edited: 2:46 pm, March 12, 2020
if you purchased insurance, go that route then everyone is wide openBUT is it cancel for any reason?I ask because if not, TCI is code zero, most insurances won't pay for "just in case "
I was just curious what that specific company did. We don't want money back so I wasn't sure if the insurance hassle was needed. We just want to change dates.

KelseyW changing dates is like a refund, they couldn't rent out yours at short notice, and now you'll block the calendar for future potential money they could make just renting the dates outSo if you bought insurance, using it is the right thing to do!

We are due to travel April too and considering cancellation I’m a health care worker and work privately too and concerned about both returning back to Canada with virus or even travelling there and taking with me, just never know!!! Very difficult but would just move y vacation to next April, disappointing but safety first.
Totally agree with fhis

We also cancelled our upcoming trip in a couple of weeks. We never buy trip insurance. No issues with our airline (WestJet), money just goes to a travel bank to be used within a year. Fast Track is crediting my cc and the deposit for our stay GT will now be put towards our next booking in November.I would hope that most resorts and villa owners will work with their customers.Was looking forward to it, but with health issues it’s not worth chancing it.Edited: 5:54 pm, March 12, 2020

Since we are going back for Christmas, TCVillas will apply our refund to our new rental. The only snag is the owners of our current rental are not the same owners as our Christmas rental, so I hope there is no problem. I spoke with TCVillas today, and it seems like they are working hard to accommodate the situation, although we haven't heard the final word from them yet. We did not have insurance.Jet Blue is issuing a credit that requires you to book within one year even though you can travel later than the one year date. You just have to book within the year.
Will be there in a few weeks God willing unless there is a drastic change in conditions or a travel restriction.Edited: 6:47 pm, March 12, 2020

We are scheduled for arrival on 4/4 and we are kicking around rescheduling to later dates. Like Tropicalbird, we are not spring chickens either with both my wife and I in our 60's. Our villa owner will allow us to change our dates to a year out, now just trying to see what Jet Blue will do. Their website says if cancelled money is put in a travel bank to be used within 1 year of ticket issuance, which was January 19. I'd like to, if we choose to do so, move the dates out to next April as the villa owners vacation for the months of October and November so those months are out. We'll see how it all plays out.Edited: 7:16 pm, March 12, 2020
Keater04, Jet Blue said that as long as you BOOK within the year, you don't have to fly out within the year. The year expiration date is only for booking, not travelling.

Thank you! It’s comforting to know they are easy to work with during this. We truly don’t want to miss this vacation. Things seemed to escalate where we live so we are hoping to know more in the coming days.
keater one year from your ticket issuance could actually be that you would be required to book travel by then. Not actually take a trip by then. I found that out with a Delta flight I was credited.
Keater, I know it’s a different airline, but was told by West Jet that we had to BOOK within the year, but NOT have to travel within the year. Only for us it was a year from cancellation..

Thanks all I appreciate the clarification. I'm trying to call Jet Blue but wait times have been extensive. If it's booking within a year, that would not be an issue as we'd rebook as soon as April of 21 flights came out.
I just read that there are two people in quarantine on turks and a possible 5 others. This was on the TCI weekly news. Has anyone else seen this?
They are being proactive and monitoring. Nothing confirmed at this time.Could be anyone with a cold and a cough.

Currently in Provo - had no problems traveling here, but arrived on a Saturday and customs took 2 hours. Most I’ve ever had it take in the past was 45 minutes. You get a questionnaire about the virus-no other screening. A local said there are 6 people on the island who are quarantined, but no positive tests here yet.
The TC government site informs of 6 in quarantine 2 awaiting test results, saw this late last night
Have they stopped flights from coming in from certain areas? Like Italy etc?
Where can I find this page???

Ministry of health Turks Update Mar 11thThey are awaiting the test results. I just decided not to travel first because I’m a health cate worker and had booked 2 weeks for April so if things get worse don’t want to get stuck (I work privately with 6 regular clients) and also would not want to risk carrying anything to Turns if they don’t confirm cases there. Tough decisions for us all.
We are scheduled to arrive from Toronto on March 23. Playing it by ear for now and not sure what to do.

We are scheduled to arrive on the 23rd as well, flying out of JFK. We are in our 60's and have pretty much avoided contact with the outside world for this past week. The only thing that will stop us is if they shut down the airlines (Delta). Hoping that won't happen, we love our TCI vacation.
Thank you. We're definitely going as long as the flights are flying!
We're leaving in the a.m. as planned!

I am so torn on what to do! My husband still wants to go as do I but I just want to be smart about it. We are in our 30's and luckily very healthy. My concerns are IF we would to pass it to someone unknowingly and if we do get sick and we are not home. Plus we will have our daughter with us (3 yrs). We are supposed to leave in two weeks. We will continue to monitor but hoping to make a decision in a few days.

Bravo! I look at it this way - there doesn't seem to be any cure for it at this point and if I'm gonna die from Covid-19, it might as well be in paradise! Besides, there have been numerous positive cases near me in NY and I want to get the hell out of here! I have been avoiding people and places for 2 weeks so I stay healthy for the trip!

I am suppose to leave on 3/21. My concern is if there is a outbreak on the island not being able to get back into the US or facing a mandatory 14 day quarantine. So upset with this happening. I am holding off cancelling as long as I can hoping for a miracle

We cancelled...the Canadian government is advising all Canadians to stop international travel. Some provinces are putting into place a mandatory 14 day quarantine when returning to Canada. This is getting very serious now as schools, tourist attractions and events are being cancelled to try and stop the spread here. I did not want to cancel but I think it is the appropriate things to do at this point until the virus is less of a threat.

Not fer nuthin, but if you can afford Turks & Caicos to begin with, I can't think of anyplace else I'd rather be quarantined if required! There are no confirmed cases as of today, while there are many cases here in NY. Get me outta here!
Not if you heard about their quarantine facility.

As tewks stated the quarantine facility is not very impressive, it's the old hospital in Blue Hills which has been abandoned for years. Additionally the current hospital has no where the facilities to treat if you're infected while on island. Even if you have medevac insurance they would probably have issues treating you prior to you being flown off island. This is one of the primary reasons we decided to cancel our trip, it was the right decision for us.Edited: 1:53 pm, March 13, 2020
<< " I can't think of anyplace else I'd rather be quarantined if required!" >>You won't be quarantined at Amanyara, The Somerset, or Grace Bay Club.

Rhode Island just imposed a 14 day self quarantine when returning from ANY foreign country. Governor will be signing an executive order. Now I have to sadly cancel. Who knows what shoe will fall next. :(
<< "Rhode Island just imposed a 14 day self quarantine" >>Source/Link please.NVRMNDhttps://www.golocalprov.com/news/breaking-ra…Edited: 2:42 pm, March 13, 2020

In Rhode Island, other steps announced Friday include a ban on visits to nursing homes and an executive order requiring that anyone who has traveled internationally must self-quarantine for 14 days after returning from abroad. The governor has already signed emergency regulations expanding eligibility for unemployment and other benefits.https:/…

Happy to see that some of you have searched your souls and decided against traveling. It's the right thing to do at this time. Take one for the team.Those of you still traveling, if they let you. Please reconsider what you are doing. TCI will still be there when this is all over. Sure you may be young and healthy but you could potentially pass the virus to someone who isn't. You don't want to live with that. Or maybe you can. I couldn't. South Korea's government is testing 10,000 a day. The US government is testing apx 200 a day. Something is wrong here.

Just returned from TC Sunday the 8th I was sent home from the Healthcare facility where I work today and need to self quarantine until the 23rd because I traveled outside of the US Check with your employer. Restrictions are changing rapidly

We just returned yesterday, and were there while all heck was breaking loose in the US. That being said, now that I have seen the island first hand - it is gorgeous but NOT where I'd want to be if I was in need of healthcare. People can carry a virus without knowing and a virus could decimate that tiny island. My perspective of the situation and how it pertains to TCI changed after seeing the island firsthand.

We just got back from the island on monday night and i am glad we are home. I feel like we got home at just the right time before everything got worse. I would cancel my trip if i was someone going in the next few weeks(or longer). You dont want to be stuck on the island. As much as hubby and i joked about it and said we wish we could be, you really would not want to be there as you would not be quarantined to your fancy resort. Also you dont want to bring something unknowingly to the people in turks. Or bring the virus home from the airplane or wherever and infect the elderly or people with conditions who cant fight it. It feels much better to be home when these kinds of scary things are happening. Just my opinion. Sorry to all of you in this position :(

Take one for the team? Wow. What sanctimonious nonsense. We look forward to our time in TCI all year. As of today, there are no confirmed cases in TCI. I guess what I meant about being quarantined in TCI was not being sick, but being unable to return to JFK. Frankly, I doubt NY will shut down the airports. They haven't even shut down all of the schools! And the Governor of RI can't enforce a 14 day "self-quarantine" after international travel unless he's prepared to administer tests to every international traveller and give them the results at the airport in 3 hours. If someone tests positive then he'd have grounds for mandatory quarantine.Edited: 11:24 pm, March 13, 2020
Liza, you really should research where you’ll end up if you have to be quarantined. Not nice. Something to consider.Edited: 11:52 pm, March 13, 2020
Lisa, the governor of RI is a SHE

Don't you mean the Gov. of RI identifies as a female? LOL, why the heck would I care what gender the Gov. is regarding voluntary self-quarantine regulations? I still have 9 days before our flight. I will be watching this on a day by day basis. If, as of 3/20, the flights are flying and there are no confirmed cases in TCI, paradise here we come. In 2009, 12,500+ people died from H1N1. I do NOT recall any mass closures, people with masks, urging for testing, quarantines or panic buying. This is mostly political. They couldn't get Trump with Russia or impeachment so they'll do it with a virus. This fearmongering vis irrational.
Ahhh.. this explains everything. Please don’t get your news about this virus from Fox. It’s not political. Get your head out of the sand.

You can't possibly be serious. What if YOU unknowingly have the virus and you take it down there. You infect a ton of people. Then you and your privilege get to fly home to the US, while all of the poor TCI folks get to duke it out to see who gets one of the couple dozen hospital beds. That country and the population there are unable to handle the consequences of a pandemic and the population could get wiped out quickly.

You're really serious? You think NY is more equipped to "handle" this? I have been washing my hands until my skin is like sandpaper. I use Lysol wipes on my grocery cart and even switched to Amazon Fresh home delivery on the 10th. I teleconferenced with my doctor to get my prescription refills so I wouldn't have to go into the office and I wear a mask and bring Lysol wipes with me if I have to run a local errand. Just stop your nonsense. It's not like it's the bubonic plague for goodness sake.
I respect and listen to Dr. Fauci, he seems pretty spot on. He appears on every channel though .... oops.
We have made the tough decision to postpone our trip. Our accommodations were very flexible with us which was so helpful. May everyone stay healthy!

Lisa there is no question that the USA is more equipped to handle a pandemic than TCI. It's odd that you're taking all these health safety measures at home yet you think the virus is a conspiracy to take down Trump.

how didtravel go? we are scheduled for monday and heard arrivals in turks was insane and crazy!

I know it is hard during high season for the island to lose valuable tourist dollars however the risk of a serious outbreak on any island would be extremely difficult for everyone. I am not that worried about the virus as some are but the conditions that are going on throughout the world don't seem like it would be wise for me to travel if they don't improve. I will just see if I can book for next year.

I work in a tourism based industry and I am telling you to stay home. You feel safe because we have zero confirmed cases? Easy to stay virus free when we have zero ability to test for it here. Tests are being sent off and have a week wait time for results. So far they have sent off two. The number of people in quarantine is up to 13 now. The quarantine site is the old AIDS Clinic in Blue Hills. Last time I saw it, I think it had two beds.We have no ability to treat COVID-19. We have a twenty bed hospital. I think we have two ventilators on island and who knows if they are even working. When it gets here, it will be almost impossible to stop. We have a large population of illegals working across many sectors who will not seek medical help; they also will not self quarantine. They will continue to work. The virus will spread unchecked in those communities.Choosing to travel here at this time is nothing short of foolish. You are putting both your families and us at unnecessary risk. You at least have the luxury of returning home to a good, if expensive, medical system.

Sheepmom,LOL! Did you just toss a bucketful of ad hominems at me? So silly. I should flag your hateful post, but that's what your side does. I believe in free speech and allowing people like you to make a jerk of yourself in front of the whole world.I can't wait to get to TCI and away from the panicked blue meanies here in NY. My hotel said if need be, they can always find us a room if we need to extend our stay.Edited: 7:37 pm, March 14, 2020

Mama Osa,If you work in a tourism based industry in TCI, you are doing your country no favor by trying to drive away millions in tourist dollars. Wash your hands and eat healthy. Disinfect surface areas that other people touch. It's not that difficult. I read they are screening arrivals at the airport. And I'll let you in on a little secret ... NY is only testing people with a fever over 100.4 F. No one can get a corona test yet without symptoms. Again, it's not the bubonic plague and the average age of the U.S. deaths is 82.

For my wife and I, who are in our 60's with underlying health issues, we thought it was in our best interest to cancel our trip, that's it plain and simple. Just want to provide a slight update for any/all of you. I am scheduled to arrive at PLS Wednesday afternoon and as you can imagine, have become increasingly anxious about all of this. As a younger couple, after reading this whole thread my main concern was becoming quarantined there for some reason.After trying to call the hotline over the past few days with no success, I sat here thinking there was no way they’d pick up. Apparently the fact that everyone else probably thinks the same thing, I had some success.
